headline: Bill Nygren Isn’t Worried About Market Volatility. He Likes GM, Delta, and Capital One Stocks.
summary: Bill Nygren isn’t worried about the recent market volatility. The  manager and chief investment officer of the U.S. for Harris Oakmark thinks now is still a great time to be hunting for value stocks.  “The last two weeks haven’t changed things,” Nygren said Thursday at a media breakfast in New York for Oakmark’s parent company, Natixis Investment Managers, referring to the market’s recent pullback, which accelerated Thursday despite strong earnings from  Nvidia  “We look for names that have been left behind.”  Along those lines, Nygren said there are numerous stocks in the  trading for below 15 times earnings estimates.

headline: Capital One (COF) Down 8.2% Since Last Earnings Report: Can It Rebound?
summary: Capital One (COF) reported earnings 30 days ago. What's next for the stock? We take a look at earnings estimates for some clues.

headline: Capital One joins FedNow
summary: The bank signed up for the Federal Reserve’s real-time payments system this week, leaving just one of the five major U.S. banks that has not.

raw.headline: Capital One joins FedNow
raw.summary: The bank signed up for the Federal Reserve’s real-time payments system this week, leaving just one of the five major U.S. banks that has not.

headline: 15 Dividend Stocks to Buy in a Market That Hates Payouts
summary: Look for companies with low payout ratios and the ability to raise dividends via earnings growth, a sign that they have ample net income to pay out more to shareholders.
